title: Chat History & Stream Management Rules
description: Guidelines for the chronological organization, forensic metadata, and persistence of session logs.

values.name: Raw Stream (.txt)
values.rule: Generated automatically via the `script` command at PID initiation. Lives in `dynamic/stream/`.
values.rationale: Provides a raw, unedited forensic record of every terminal interaction and tool call.

values.name: Refined Chat (.json)
values.rule: Generated manually via the user's `/chat share` command. Refined chats are typically left in the project root (`gemini/`) or migrated to the persistent `memory/json/` directory (located alongside `.swarm_comms`).
values.rationale: Acts as the high-fidelity 'negotiated settlement' of the session, optimized for future context injection.

values.name: Forensic Process Metadata
values.rule: Shared chat logs should ideally capture ProcessInfo: PID, CPU/Memory utilization, and creation time.
values.rationale: Aligns with the firm's DTO (Data Transfer Object) standard for monitoring agent metabolic health.

values.name: Chat Log Locality Rule
values.rule: Never commit conversation files to the orchestrator root.
values.rationale: Keeps the orchestrator lean while ensuring the Heartwood captures the full depth of swarm interaction.
